intro: Drosanthemum acuminatum, commonly known as the sharp-leaved drosanthemum, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, making it well adapted to drought conditions. Drosanthemum acuminatum is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and resilience.
